instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message:
Hey guys,

got a 16" here. Corrosion around <CHIP>U7410</CHIP>.

amp meter goes: 0.03 - 0.18 - 0.27/0.31 and jumping and staying to 0.07

put a new <CHIP>U7410</CHIP> - and replaced all compontens around it.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU</SIGNAL> is 12.6V

resistance to ground on l7410 pin 2 and l7420 pin2 is 7OHM.


what to do? any chance? cpu gone?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message:
Did you connect known good battery?
Be sure to use 96/140W charger.

Machine is detected in DFU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message:
yes to the battery, when connected its taking about 4A

96W charger - yes.

DFU-Mode no. no sign of life in apple configurator

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message:
That's really strange; did you follow all the steps from DFU tutorial?
Check all SSD, G3S, AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message: oh yea. wrong port. dfu is recognized. did revive. seems to got trough. no image.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message:
L7410/20 may have low resistance to ground as normal.
Compare with similar board, if possible.
Do you get voltage on other big coils?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message:
yes, 7 ohm, like described. looks good.

no voltage on other big coils...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message: If you have good board on hands, compare diode mode readings on all coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message: dont have a good board on hands...have a 15" donor board here...readings almost same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message: You can try DFU restore, if no important data on its SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message:
All G3S and SSD voltages present?
Be sure no short to ground on any big coil.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
threads.message:
SSDs are there.
5v/1.8v g3s are there

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3SSW_SNS</SIGNAL> is missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - stuck at 20V 0.07A - tries to boot
